contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:ET''' is the entry for [[Ethiopia]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Ethiopia, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[regions of Ethiopia|2 administrations and 9 states]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>ET</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Ethiopia. The second part is two letters. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). [[ISO 639-1]] codes are used to represent subdivision names in the following [[official language|administrative language]]s: * (am): [[Amharic language|Amharic]] * (en): [[English language|English]] ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name ([[Amharic language|am]]) ! Subdivision name ([[English language|en]]) ! Subdivision category |- | <tt>ET-AA</tt> | {{sort|Adīs Ābeba|Ādīs Ābeba}} | [[Addis Ababa]] | administration |- | <tt>ET-DD</tt> | Dirē Dawa | [[Dire Dawa]] | administration |- | <tt>ET-AF</tt> | {{sort|Afar|Āfar}} | [[Afar Region|Afar]] | state |- | <tt>ET-AM</tt> | {{sort|Amara|Āmara}} | [[Amara Region|Amara]] | state |- | <tt>ET-BE</tt> | Bīnshangul Gumuz | [[Benshangul-Gumaz Region|Benshangul-Gumaz]] | state |- | <tt>ET-GA</tt> | Gambēla Hizboch | [[Gambela Peoples Region|Gambela Peoples']] | state |- | <tt>ET-HA</tt> | Hārerī Hizb | [[Harari People Region|Harari People]] | state |- | <tt>ET-OR</tt> | Oromīya | [[Oromia Region|Oromia]] | state |- | <tt>ET-SO</tt> | Sumalē | [[Somali Region|Somali]] | state |- | <tt>ET-TI</tt> | Tigray | [[Tigrai Region|Tigrai]] | state |- | <tt>ET-SN</tt> | YeDebub Bihēroch Bihēreseboch na Hizboch | [[Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Region|Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples']] | state |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Change of generic name of one subdivision category to administration. Addition of an administration. Update of list sources | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>ET-DD</tt> [[Dire Dawa]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Ethiopia]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (D-F)#ET: Ethiopia|FIPS region codes of Ethiopia]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/uet.html States of Ethiopia], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Et}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:ET]] [[Category:Regions of Ethiopia|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Ethiopia geography-related lists]]
